---
title: "TemperaturShift"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```


```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```


```{r}
data.frame(temp = seq(-15,45,0.1)) %>%
  mutate(old = 100*dnorm(temp, mean = 15, sd = 9),
         new = 100*dnorm(temp, mean = 17, sd = 9)
         ) %>%
  gather(key = "scenario",
         value = density,
         old,
         new,
         factor_key = TRUE
         ) ->
  df_plot
```



```{r}
ggplot(df_plot,
       mapping = aes(x = temp,
                     y = density,
                     color = scenario
                     )
       )+
  geom_line(size = 1.5)+
  ylim(c(0,6))+
  geom_segment(x = 0,
               y = -1,
               xend = 0,
               yend = 3.2,
               color = "black",
               linetype = "dashed"
               )+
  geom_segment(x = 10,
               y = -1,
               xend = 10,
               yend = 5.2,
               color = "black",
               linetype = "dashed"
               )+
  geom_segment(x = 25,
               y = -1,
               xend = 25,
               yend = 5.2,
               color = "black",
               linetype = "dashed"
               )+
  geom_segment(x = 30,
               y = -1,
               xend = 30,
               yend = 3.2,
               color = "black",
               linetype = "dashed"
               )+
  geom_segment(x = 10,
               y = 5,
               xend = 25,
               yend = 5,
               color = "black",
               size = 0.5,
               arrow = arrow(ends = "both",
                             type = "closed",
                             length = unit(0.1,"inches")
                             )
                 )+
geom_segment(x = 25,
             y = 4,
             xend = 45,
             yend = 4,
             color = "black",
             size = 0.5,
             arrow = arrow(ends = "last",
                           type = "closed",
                           length = unit(0.1,"inches")
                           )
             )+
geom_segment(x = 30,
             y = 3,
             xend = 45,
             yend = 3,
             color = "black",
             size = 0.5,
             arrow = arrow(ends = "last",
                           type = "closed",
                           length = unit(0.1,"inches")
                           )
             )+
geom_segment(x = 10,
             y = 4,
             xend = -15,
             yend = 4,
             color = "black",
             size = 0.5,
             arrow = arrow(ends = "last",
                           type = "closed",
                           length = unit(0.1,"inches")
                           )
             )+
geom_segment(x = 0,
             y = 3,
             xend = -15,
             yend = 3,
             color = "black",
             size = 0.5,
             arrow = arrow(ends = "last",
                           type = "closed",
                           length = unit(0.1,"inches")
                           )
             )+
  theme_minimal()+
  labs(x = "Tageshöchsttemperatur (in Grad)",
       y = "Verteilungsdichte (in Prozent pro Grad)",
       color = "Szenario",
       title = "Shift der jährlichen Temperaturverteilung um 2 Grad"
       )+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(-15,45,5))+
  annotate("text",
           x = 17.5,
           y = 5.5,
           label = "Moderate Tage \n 211 -> 217")+
  annotate("text",
           x = -2.5,
           y = 4.5,
           label = "Kalte Tage \n 105 -> 80")+
  annotate("text",
           x = -7.5,
           y = 2.5,
           label = "Eisige Tage \n 17 -> 11")+
    annotate("text",
           x = 37.5,
           y = 2.5,
           label = "Heiße Tage \n 17 -> 27")+
    annotate("text",
           x = 35,
           y = 4.5,
           label = "Warme Tage \n 49 -> 68")+
  theme(panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5)
        )+
  scale_color_manual(values = c("blue","red"),
                     labels = c("Normal","+2 Grad") 
                     )->
  plot_temp

plot_temp
```
